com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface TitanMultiVertexQuery

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseVertexQuery
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiVertexCentricQueryBuilder

    public interface TitanMultiVertexQuery
extends BaseVertexQuery
    A MultiVertexQuery is identical to a VertexQuery but executed against a set of vertices simultaneously. In other words, TitanMultiVertexQuery allows identical VertexQuery executed against a non-trivial set of vertices to be executed in one batch which can significantly reduce the query latency.

    The query specification methods are identical to VertexQuery. The result set method return Maps from the specified set of anchor vertices to their respective individual result sets.

    Note, that the limit(int) constraint applies to each individual result set.

    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

      • has

        TitanMultiVertexQuery has(String type,
                        Object value)
        Description copied from interface: BaseVertexQuery
        Query only for edges that have an incident property or unidirected edge matching the given value.

        If type is a property key, then the query is restricted to edges having an incident property matching this key-value pair. If type is an edge label, then it is expected that this label is unidirected (TitanLabel.isUnidirected() and the query is restricted to edges having an incident unidirectional edge pointing to the value which is expected to be a TitanVertex.

        Specified by:
        has in interface BaseVertexQuery
        Parameters:
        type - TitanType name
        value - Value for the property of the given key to match, or vertex to point unidirectional edge to
        Returns:
        this query

      • limit

        TitanMultiVertexQuery limit(int limit)
        Description copied from interface: BaseVertexQuery
        Sets the retrieval limit for this query.

        When setting a limit, executing this query will only retrieve the specified number of relations. Note, that this also applies to counts.

        Specified by:
        limit in interface BaseVertexQuery
        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of relations to retrieve for this query
        Returns:
        this query

      • vertices

        Map<TitanVertex,Iterable<TitanVertex>> vertices()
        Retrieves all vertices connected to each of the query's central vertices by edges matching the conditions defined in this query.

        No guarantee is made as to the order in which the vertices are returned.

        Returns:
        An iterable of all vertices connected to each of the query's central vertices by matching edges

      • vertexIds

        Map<TitanVertex,VertexList> vertexIds()
        Retrieves all vertices connected to each of the query's central vertices by edges matching the conditions defined in this query.

        No guarantee is made as to the order in which the vertices are listed. Use VertexList.sort() to sort by vertex idAuthorities most efficiently.

        The query engine will determine the most efficient way to retrieve the vertices that match this query.

        Returns:
        A list of all vertices' ids connected to each of the query's central vertex by matching edges
